summary: This is a reply memorandum filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys in support of a motion to suppress evidence obtained from a grand jury subpoena issued to the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP and to dismiss Counts Five and Six of her indictment. The filing alleges that a prosecutor (AUSA) made materially false statements to Chief Judge McMahon in an ex parte proceeding to circumvent a protective order from a prior civil defamation case, thereby unlawfully obtaining 90,000 pages of material central to the government's case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, filing a motion to suppress evidence obtained via a subpoena to her former opponent's law firm, Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, and to dismiss perjury-related counts.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, signatory on the reply memorandum from Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, listed from Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Cohen & Gresser LLP, signatory on the certificate of service.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Stemheim

persons.name: Peter Skinner
persons.context: Attorney from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP who met with AUSA in 2016 and provided documents regarding allegations against Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: Stan Pottinger
persons.context: Attorney involved in the 2016 meeting with AUSA, representing a victim in the civil defamation case against Maxwell.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Attorney involved in the 2016 meeting with AUSA, representing a victim in the civil defamation case against Maxwell; quoted in a Daily News article.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Attorney from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP copied on emails regarding the 2016 contacts with the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Named attorney from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP; quoted in a Daily News article about pressing for prosecution of Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier; the 2016 meeting with prosecutors concerned allegations of sexual abuse and trafficking by him and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Judge McMahon
persons.context: Chief Judge of the Southern District of New York who authorized the subpoena to Boies Schiller after an ex parte proceeding where AUSA allegedly made false statements.

persons.name: Judge Sweet
persons.context: Judge presiding over the prior civil defamation case who entered the protective order that was later circumvented.

persons.name: Judge Netburn
persons.context: Judge who denied a government ex parte request to modify a protective order in a related case, citing due process concerns.

persons.name: Judge Preska
persons.context: Judge who redacted material from documents on remand, reflecting that Maxwell reasonably relied on the protective order.

persons.name: Alison Moe
persons.context: Government prosecutor served with the reply memorandum.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Government prosecutor served with the reply memorandum.

persons.name: Andrew Rohrbach
persons.context: Government prosecutor served with the reply memorandum.

persons.name: Lam Pomerantz
persons.context: Government prosecutor served with the reply memorandum.

connections.description: Described in the document as alleged co-conspirators in a sex trafficking scheme, with Maxwell termed Epstein's 'head recruiter'.
Skinner was an attorney for Maxwell's opponent in a civil defamation suit and participated in meetings with prosecutors advocating for her criminal investigation.
Edwards was an attorney for a victim suing Maxwell for defamation and participated in meetings with prosecutors advocating for her criminal investigation.
Pottinger was an attorney for a victim suing Maxwell for defamation and participated in meetings with prosecutors advocating for her criminal investigation.
Skinner met with AUSA in 2016 to provide allegations and documents to instigate a criminal investigation of Epstein and Maxwell.
Edwards met with AUSA in 2016 to provide allegations and documents to instigate a criminal investigation of Epstein and Maxwell.
Pottinger met with AUSA in 2016 to provide allegations and documents to instigate a criminal investigation of Epstein and Maxwell.
AUSA made ex parte representations to Judge McMahon that are alleged to have been materially false and misleading, leading to the authorization of a subpoena.
Pagliuca is one of Maxwell's defense attorneys filing this motion on her behalf.

events.title: Meeting between Boies Schiller attorneys and AUSA
events.description: Attorneys Peter Skinner, Stan Pottinger, and Brad Edwards met with AUSA to present allegations of sexual abuse and trafficking by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, and to advocate for a criminal prosecution.

events.title: First deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was deposed in the civil defamation case. The deposition transcripts were later sought by the government via subpoena.

events.title: Second deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was deposed a second time in the civil defamation case. The deposition transcripts were later sought by the government via subpoena.

events.title: Government investigation begins (claimed)
events.description: The government claimed its investigation began in November 2018, a claim contested by the defense which points to earlier contacts in 2016.

events.title: AUSA requests documents from AUSA
events.description: AUSA emailed AUSA requesting all records of the February 29, 2016 meeting with Boies Schiller attorneys, seeking to 'get a complete handle on the landscape'.

events.title: Ex parte proceeding before Judge McMahon
events.description: AUSA appeared before Chief Judge McMahon in an ex parte proceeding and allegedly made false statements denying prior contacts with Boies Schiller, leading to the authorization of a subpoena for the firm's files.

events.title: Prosecutors' call with AUSA
events.description: Prosecutors conducted a phone call with AUSA to discuss the 2016 events; her memory was frequently cited as lacking recall.

events.title: Filing of Maxwell's reply memorandum
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team filed this reply memorandum in support of her motion to suppress evidence and dismiss counts.

keyFacts: The defense alleges that a prosecutor (AUSA) made materially false statements to Chief Judge McMahon in an April 2019 ex parte proceeding, denying any prior contacts between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP before November 2018.

Contrary to the prosecutor's statements, there was a meeting on February 29, 2016, where Boies Schiller attorneys (Peter Skinner, Stan Pottinger, Brad Edwards) met with AUSA to present allegations and advocate for a criminal investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

The government obtained approximately 90,000 pages of material from Boies Schiller via a grand jury subpoena authorized by Judge McMahon, which the defense argues is central to the government's case and was obtained unlawfully due to the alleged misrepresentations.

The defense motion seeks to suppress all evidence obtained from the Boies Schiller subpoena and to dismiss Counts Five and Six (perjury-related counts) as the 'fruits' of that evidence, or, at a minimum, to obtain an evidentiary hearing.

The document references a prior civil defamation case (v. Maxwell) with a protective order that the government allegedly circumvented through its ex parte request, violating Maxwell's due process rights.
